Aniket's Notes

Lorentz Force

F=q(E+v×B)\mathbf{F}=q(\mathbf{E}+\mathbf{v}\times \mathbf{B})F=q(E+v×B)

Cyclotron motion

QvB=mv2R,p=QBRQvB=\frac{mv^2}{R}, \hspace{0.5cm} p=QBRQvB=Rmv2​,p=QBR

💡 Magnetic forces do not work

Fmag=q(v×B)F_{mag}=q(v\times B)Fmag​=q(v×B) dWmag=Fmag.dl=q(v×B).vdt=0dW_{mag}=F_{mag}.dl=q(v\times B).vdt=0dWmag​=Fmag​.dl=q(v×B).vdt=0 Fmag=I∫(dl×B)F_{mag}=I\int(dl\times B)Fmag​=I∫(dl×B)

Continuity equation:

∇.J=∂ρ∂t\mathbf{\nabla.J}=\frac{\partial \rho}{\partial t}∇.J=∂t∂ρ​

Biot-Savart law

The magnetic field of steady line current is given as

B(r)=μ04πI∫dl′×r^r2\mathbf{B(r)}=\frac{\mu_0}{4\pi}I\int \frac{d\mathbf{l}'\times \mathbf{\hat{r}}}{r^2}B(r)=4πμ0​​I∫r2dl′×r^​

where $\mu_0=4\pi\times 10^{-7}N/A^2$

Magnetic field due to wire

B=μ0I2πd(sin⁡θ2−sin⁡θ1)B=\frac{\mu_0I}{2\pi d}(\sin{\theta_2}-\sin{\theta_1})B=2πdμ0​I​(sinθ2​−sinθ1​)

Divergence and Curl of B

Divergence of B

B(r)=μ04π∫J(r′)×r^r2dτ′\mathbf{B(r)}=\frac{\mu_0}{4\pi}\int \frac{\mathbf{J(r')\times\hat{r}}}{r^2}d\tau'B(r)=4πμ0​​∫r2J(r′)×r^​dτ′ ∇.B=μ04π∫∇.(J×r^r2)dτ′\mathbf{\nabla.B}=\frac{\mu_0}{4\pi}\int\mathbf{\nabla}.\left( \mathbf{J}\times\frac{\mathbf{\hat{r}}}{r^2} \right)d\tau'∇.B=4πμ0​​∫∇.(J×r2r^​)dτ′ ∇.(J×r^r2)=r^r2.(∇×J)−J.(∇×r^r2)dτ′\mathbf{\nabla}.\left( \mathbf{J}\times\frac{\mathbf{\hat{r}}}{r^2} \right)=\frac{\mathbf{\hat{r}}}{r^2}.(\mathbf{\nabla\times J})-\mathbf{J}.\left( \mathbf{\nabla}\times\frac{\mathbf{\hat{r}}}{r^2} \right)d\tau'∇.(J×r2r^​)=r2r^​.(∇×J)−J.(∇×r2r^​)dτ′ ∇.B=0\mathbf{\nabla.B}=0∇.B=0

Curl of B

∇×B=μ04π∫∇×(J×r^r2)dτ′\mathbf{\nabla\times B}=\frac{\mu_0}{4\pi}\int\mathbf{\nabla}\times\left( \mathbf{J}\times\frac{\mathbf{\hat{r}}}{r^2} \right)d\tau'∇×B=4πμ0​​∫∇×(J×r2r^​)dτ′

Ampere’s law

∇×B=μ0J\mathbf{\nabla\times B}=\mu_0 J∇×B=μ0​J ∮B.dl=μ0Ienclosed\oint\mathbf{B}.d\mathbf{l}=\mu_0I_{enclosed}∮B.dl=μ0​Ienclosed​
